Detailed Description

Class CartesianCellDoubleConservativeLinearRefine implements conservative linear interpolation for cell-centered double patch data defined over a Cartesian mesh. It is derived from the base class hier::RefineOperator. The numerical operations for the interpolation use FORTRAN numerical routines.

See also:
hier::RefineOperator

Member Function Documentation

int SAMRAI::geom::CartesianCellDoubleConservativeLinearRefine::getOperatorPriority (  )  const [virtual]

The priority of cell-centered double conservative linear is 0. It will be performed before any user-defined interpolation operations.

Implements SAMRAI::hier::RefineOperator.

hier::IntVector SAMRAI::geom::CartesianCellDoubleConservativeLinearRefine::getStencilWidth ( const tbox::Dimension &  dim  )  const [virtual]

The stencil width of the conservative linear interpolation operator is the vector of ones.

Implements SAMRAI::hier::RefineOperator.

void SAMRAI::geom::CartesianCellDoubleConservativeLinearRefine::refine ( hier::Patch &  fine,
const hier::Patch &  coarse,
const int  dst_component,
const int  src_component,
const hier::BoxOverlap &  fine_overlap,
const hier::IntVector &  ratio 
) const [virtual]

Refine the source component on the coarse patch to the destination component on the fine patch using the cell-centered double conservative linear interpolation operator. Interpolation is performed on the intersection of the destination patch and the boxes contained in fine_overlap. It is assumed that the coarse patch contains sufficient data for the stencil width of the refinement operator.

Precondition:
dynamic_cast<const pdat::CellOverlap *>(&fine_overlap) != 0

Implements SAMRAI::hier::RefineOperator.

void SAMRAI::geom::CartesianCellDoubleConservativeLinearRefine::refine ( hier::Patch &  fine,
const hier::Patch &  coarse,
const int  dst_component,
const int  src_component,
const hier::Box &  fine_box,
const hier::IntVector &  ratio 
) const

Refine the source component on the coarse patch to the destination component on the fine patch using the cell-centered double conservative linear interpolation operator. Interpolation is performed on the intersection of the destination patch and the fine box. It is assumed that the coarse patch contains sufficient data for the stencil width of the refinement operator. This differs from the above refine() method only in that it operates on a single fine box instead of a BoxOverlap.

Precondition:
(fine.getDim() == coarse.getDim()) && (fine.getDim() == fine_box.getDim()) && (fine.getDim() == ratio.getDim())

coarse.getPatchData(src_component) is actually a boost::shared_ptr<pdat::CellData<double> >

fine.getPatchData(dst_component) is actually a boost::shared_ptr<pdat::CellData<double> >

coarse.getPatchData(src_component)->getDepth() == fine.getPatchData(dst_component)->getDepth()

(fine.getDim().getValue() == 1) || (fine.getDim().getValue() == 2) || (fine.getDim().getValue() == 3)
